content.description:
Multiple trees at the top that will require 30ft slings for TR setup. 

  A bit of a clambering start to a ledge that is a bit difficult to get onto the face of.  Falling off the ledge may allow you to deck with rope stretch. 

  Once on the ledge, straight forward climbing staying to the left for most of the route and moving right as you go up.  The last move that would allow you to top out is well over 5.6 so topping out is not recommended.
content.protection: No anchors/bolts but a trio of good sized trees at the top provides good pro with long slings.  At least 1 30ft sling required if multiple trees are used.
content.location: After walking down the main path to the crag, there is a area of flat rock where people frequently picnic.  Sun Rock is about 15ft to the left.  Rap down or there are routes to the bottom both to the left (more clambering) or right which is more sloping.

content.description:
Simple Route on the backside of a flat boulder east of a large, graffiti covered rock face. 

 Sit start and reach large ledge of rock. Good holds to the right help with topping out.
content.location: Boulder is located east of a large rock face covered in graffiti. head up hill and you should see a large triangular rock and the backside of the boulder. Route starts below the noticeable ledge on the rock.

content.description: Nothing overly difficult here unless you intentionally make it so.  There are places to play with laybacks and finger wedging as well as ledges and roots that can make it as easy as climbing a ladder.  Lots of room for resting on wide ledges.
content.location: After walking down the main path, there is a crevasse to the left about 40 yards.  Trees on the river side of the crack make for plenty of protection.  Watch for trash and lots of painting on the walls.  Stays shaded so you want to be there when it has been dry for a while.

content.description: Secluded undeveloped climbing spot adjacent to the Allegheny river.  Sandstone cliffs range from small to 75 feet.  Top-roping only, no bolts.  Rock is solid but often wet in areas.  Best months to climb are summer and autumn when the rock is dry.
